member.name: P:Cake.AppleSimulator.AppleSimulator.Availability
member.summary: The status of the simulator (shutdown, booted, unavailable, unaviable, reason xxxx)
member.example: (unavailable, failed to open liblaunch_sim.dylib) (unavailable, runtime profile not found) (unavailable, Mac OS X 10.11.5 is not supported)

member.name: P:Cake.AppleSimulator.AppleSimulator.Name
member.summary: The human name of the simulator (i.e. iPhone 6s, Apple TV 1080p, Apple Watch - 38mm)

member.name: P:Cake.AppleSimulator.AppleSimulator.Runtime
member.summary: The simulator runtime (i.e. iOS 9.3, tvOS 9.2, watchOS 2.2)

member.name: P:Cake.AppleSimulator.AppleSimulator.UDID
member.summary: The unique identifier, that identifies the simulator and is used for operations such as start, create, shutdown, pair.

member.name: P:Cake.AppleSimulator.AppleSimulator.IsAvailable
member.summary: The status of the simulator

member.name: P:Cake.AppleSimulator.AppleSimulator.AvailabilityError
member.summary: The error code of the simulator if not available

member.name: M:Cake.AppleSimulator.AppleSimulatorAliases.EraseAppleSimulator(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,System.String)
member.summary: Erases and factory resets the specified simulator.

member.name: M:Cake.AppleSimulator.AppleSimulatorAliases.EraseAppleSimulator(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,System.String,Cake.AppleSimulator.SimCtl.SimCtlSettings)
member.summary: Erases and factory resets the specified simulator.

member.name: M:Cake.AppleSimulator.AppleSimulatorAliases.LaunchAppleSimulator(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,System.String)
member.summary: Boot the specified simulator, headless in the background. This operation returns immiedately and does not block, you need to put the cake thread to sleep/pause execution to allow time for the simulator to boot.

member.name: M:Cake.AppleSimulator.AppleSimulatorAliases.LaunchAppleSimulator(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,System.String,Cake.AppleSimulator.Simulator.SimulatorSettings)
member.summary: Boot the specified simulator, headless in the background. This operation returns immiedately and does not block, you need to put the cake thread to sleep/pause execution to allow time for the simulator to boot.

member.summary: Installs an application on the specified simulator.

member.name: T:Cake.AppleSimulator.AppleSimulatorConfigurationSettings
member.summary: not implemented yet, these will be options to customize settings of the simulator before boot. Stuff like disabling auto-correction... see https://github.com/plu/simctl/blob/master/lib/simctl/device_settings.rb
